bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, November 22, 1902

div1.p: Howard asks Carroll for extra copies of his paper on the yellow fever mosquito. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, November 22, 1902
div1.p:
Thank you for your note about the Lazier photo-
graph. I misunderstood you, I am greatly distressed to learn of
Dr. Reed's illness. Dr. Ross, of the Navy, told me last night that
the symptoms were better yesterday.

My present object in writing you is to ask you whether you have
extras of any of your papers on the yellow fever mosquito which you
can send to Mr. Geo. C. Rand, of 107 Wall Street, New York. His
firm is very much interested in the yellow fever question, since it
has a large staff in Brazil and also offices in Mexico and Java.
Anything whatever relating to the yellow fever mosquito which can be
sent to him will I know be highly appreciated and very thankfully
received.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L. O. Howard Dr. James Carroll,
Army Medical Museum.
ht
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY AND PLANT QUARANTINE.
Office of the Chief, Press Copies of Letters Sent.
Three Centimeters
